what's the difference between the old style of formatting such as %5.2f and the new style {:5.2f}
if I'm understanding the question correctly...
the .format makes you list the variables at the end
(higher room for error imo)
and the f'{} allows you to type individual variables as you need them so you don't have to list them in order after you typed out the string
(less chance of error)
both do the job just fine though
it is a matter of preference
